Get the Web Tracker SDK
arrow_forward_ios

Get the Web Tracker SDK

To get started, you can download the web tracker SDK from here.

Download SDK (v1.2.0)

The zip file contains the following:

web-tracker-1.2.0.js

The core SDK file to be embedded in your website.

README.md

Instructions on how to use the SDK.

example.html

A complete example demonstrating the SDK's functionality.

Before embedding the SDK into your website, make sure you have your tracker ID.

arrow_back_ios
PREVIOUS
Getting started
NEXT
Embed & Configurate the SDK
arrow_forward_ios

Embed & Configurate the SDK

Follow these steps to integrate the Web Tracker SDK into your website.

1. Include the SDK Script

First, you need to include the Web Tracker SDK script in your website's HTML. Place the following script tag in the </head> section of your HTML file. This will load the SDK and make it available for use.

index.html
HTML 
<script src="web-tracker-1.2.0.js"></script>

2. Initialize the SDK

Next, initialize the SDK by creating a new WebTracker instance. You'll need to provide your unique tracker ID and other configuration options. This should be done in a script tag in the <body> of your HTML, after the SDK script has been included.

tracker-setup.js
JavaScript 

const tracker = new WebTracker({
    // Replace with your unique tracker ID
    trackerId: 'example',

    // The endpoint where tracking data will be sent
    apiEndpoint: 'https://ingestor.revosurge-dev.com/collect',

    // Set to 'false' to disable the SDK completely
    enabled: true,

    // Set to 'false' to disable automatic tracking of events
    autoTrack: true,

    // Set to 'true' to request location tracking permission from the user
    geo: true
});

Parameters

Name Type Description
trackerId
String
Unique identifier issued to each workspace. Replace 'example' with the production key before going live.
apiEndpoint
String
HTTPS endpoint that receives browser events. Use the default ingest URL unless directed to point at a staging collector.
enabled
Boolean
Master toggle for all tracking. Set to false to pause outbound calls without removing implementation.
autoTrack
Boolean
Controls automatic page view and click tracking. Disable if you prefer to send only custom events manually.
geo
Boolean
Requests geolocation consent from visitors. Enable only when regional policies and privacy choices allow location capture (prompt shows only when browsers support it).
